column4: After installing windows how can I get Grub to be recognized again for dual boot?? I tried reinstalling it from the liveCD, but that didn't work.
help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
thanks
During the process should I reformat / and swap?
you shouldn't need to...
It says go to manual partitioning in the installer
look at number 5 ;)
Grub Resources??? It's just a bunch of links
no, 5 under "Using the Install CD and overwriting the Windows bootloader"
Ok, it says it must format /, /boot, /usr, /var though
No it doesnt.  DONT format them
which installer are you using?
I just downloaded and burned 6.06 Live CD and I'm using the Installer located on the desktop
ah, you need to scroll down to the "using the ubuntu lvieCD" part then
ok, thanks
How do I find out what my harddisk + boot partition numbers are?? i.e. (hd0,6)
hard disk number is easy, partition number depends on your setup.  primary IDE drives are 0 (master) and slave (1), secondary are 2 and 3 respectively
is /home on it's own partition?
no it isn't. Ljl, what' the alternate CD?
you should think about putting /home on it's own partition, then you can reinstall 'around' your home partition
Ljl, Dr_willis, thanks guys
